FuncDef:
The mpls te bandwidth command sets the BC bandwidth for a link.
The undo mpls te bandwidth command deletes the bandwidth.
By default, no BC bandwidth is configured for a link.
CLIs: mpls te bandwidth { bc0 <bc0Bw> | bc1 <bc1Bw> | bc2 <bc2Bw> | bc3 <bc3Bw> | bc4 <bc4Bw> | bc5 <bc5Bw> | bc6 <bc6Bw> | bc7 <bc7Bw> } *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth value of BC0.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC1.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC2.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC3.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC4.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC5.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC6.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth value of BC7.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In real-world situations, the bandwidth value is set on outbound interfaces along links of a TE tunnel that requires sufficient bandwidth.
To change bandwidth BC values, reconfigure the mpls te bandwidth command. The latest configured BC bandwidth value overrides the previous one.
The BC bandwidth value is deleted after the undo mpls command is run in the system view or the undo mpls te command is run in the MPLS view.
Precautions
The parameters cr1 to ct7 are only used in DS-TE scenarios.
